WORK EXPERIENCE Senior Software Engineer April 2018 - present Red Hat
Design and implement distributed, highly available, and scalable time series processing systems. Benchmark, optimize, and perform security evaluations of software. Continuously deploy services to production. Plan roadmap and features for development team and upstream. Coordinate work and dependencies with various teams and stakeholders to meet deadlines. On-board and mentor team members. Maintain upstream projects in observability space. Contribute to Kubernetes and Prometheus ecosystems. Present research and work at KubeCons and Linux Foundation conferences.


Senior Software Engineer July 2016 - April 2018 CoreOS
Architected and designed systems to deploy, securely access, and control federated clusters. Created and tested self-updating, distributed software. Developed automated Kubernetes installer for cloud platforms and baremetal servers. Evaluated and improved build-system and testing infrastructure. Planned sprints and tasks for team. Coordinated with and contributed to upstream Kubernetes projects.


Software Engineer July 2012 - July 2015 National Geographic Society
Lead a team of engineers and provided technical direction for the development of a distributed, real-time, event-processing system. Architected efficient, full-stack systems to meet project needs. Created and published open source tools to solve emerging problems. Collaborated with broader community to advance web standards.


Undergraduate Researcher April 2012 - July 2012 Center for Advanced Life Cycle Engineering, University of Maryland
Investigated and modeled Lithium-ion battery-chemistry degradation. Formulated and performed experiments to study the correlation between charge/discharge cycles and battery state-of-health through Coulomb counting. Project presented at International Symposium for Testing and Failure Analysis 2012.

OPEN SOURCE Thanos maintainer github.com/thanos-io/thanos Thanos is a highly available and distributed Prometheus metrics solution.


Kilo creator github.com/squat/kilo Kilo is a multi-cloud and multi-cluster networking solution for Kubernetes built on WireGuard.
